column1: Organ Mapping Antibody Panel (OMAP) for Multiplexed Antibody-Based Imaging of Human Intestine with CODEX

column2: Teri Longacre; Andrea J. Radtke; Christopher Werlein; Ellen M. Quardokus; Diane C. Saunders; Anna Martinez Casals; Presha Rajbhandari

column22: rationale

This marker does not define a distinct cell type, but highlights all proliferating cells, useful in various diseases and transit amplifying cells. Defines germinal centers of gut-associated lymphoid tissue (GALT). This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.

This marker can be used to identify T regulatory cells. The inclusion of FOXP3 is recommended to provide greater confidence in the T regulatory cell phenotype. This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
This marker does not define a distinct cell type but instead serves as a pan-membrane marker. It can be used to segment most cells.

Defines stromal network of intestine and serves as a pan-mesenchymal cell marker. The combination of collagen IV, pan-cytokeratin, alpha smooth muscle actin, and vimentin can be used to define the villi, crypts, basal membrane, and lamina propria. This marker represents a core panel and prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
Used for identification of NK cells.
Used for identification of NK cells.
Used for identification of NK and T cells.
Used for identification of CD4+ T cells. This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.

Essential marker of B cells and also identifies plasma cells. Defines B cell follicles of gut-associated lymphoid tissue (GALT). This marker represents a core panel and prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.

Used for identification of antigen presenting cells (B cells, dendritic cells, macrophages). Defines B cell follicles (HLA-DR+) and germinal centers (HLA-DR++) of gut-associated lymphoid tissue (GALT).
Used for identification of dendritic cells. This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
Used for identification of NK cells and other innate lymphoid cells.
Used for identification of neural cells. This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
Used for visualization of blood and lymphatic endothelial cells and vessels. Identifies fibroblasts of the muscularis propria and submucosa.
Used for identification of neutrophils. This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
Used for identification of neutrophils. Expressed by some Paneth cells. This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
Used for identification of fibroblasts.
Expressed by plasmacytoid dendritic cells.
Used for identification of mature epithelial cells and expressed on neutrophils
Essential marker of T cells. Defines T cell zone of gut-associated lymphoid tissues (GALT). This marker represents a core panel and prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
Used to define a particular T cell activation state.
Used for identification of plasma cells. This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
Expressed by stromal cells as well as blood endothelial cells, T cells, and NK cells.
Used to define a particular T cell activation state.

Used for identification of smooth muscle cells. The combination of collagen IV, pan-cytokeratin, alpha smooth muscle actin, and vimentin can be used to define the villi, crypts, basal membrane, and lamina propria. This marker represents a core panel and prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
Used for identification of Interstitial cells of Cajal and mast cells. This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.

column2: HGNC:6413, HGNC:6416, HGNC:6421, HGNC:6423, HGNC:6436, HGNC:6412, HGNC:6439, HGNC:6440, HGNC:6441, HGNC:6442, HGNC:6445, HGNC:6446
column3: Cytokeratin 10, Cytokeratin 14, Cytokeratin 15, Cytokeratin 16, Cytokeratin 19, Cytokeratin 1, Cytokeratin 2, Cytokeratin 3, Cytokeratin 4, Cytokeratin 5, Cytokeratin 7, Cytokeratin 8
column22: Pan-epithelial marker for segmentation of epithelial cells. The combination of collagen IV, pan-cytokeratin, alpha smooth muscle actin, and vimentin can be used to define the villi, crypts, basal membrane, and lamina propria. This marker represents a core panel and prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
Marker for epithelial cells, specifically enterocytes.
Nuclear marker of intestinal epithelial cells expressed by early epithelial cells.
Expressed by many subsets of myeloid cells including proinflammatory M1 macrophages. This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
Used for identification of neural cells and neuroendocrine cells. This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
Used for identification of B cells and follicular dendritic cells in gut-associated lymphoid tissue (GALT). This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
Used for identification of goblet cells. This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
Used for visualization of blood endothelial cells and vessels. This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
Used for identification of NK cells and neural cells. This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
Used for visualization of blood and lymphatic endothelial cells and vessels.
Used for identification of early secretory goblet cells.
Used to define a particular T cell activation state.
Key marker for plasma cells and broadly expressed on epithelial cells. This marker represents a core panel and prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
Used for identification of transit amplifying cells.
Used for identification of CD8+ T cells. This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
Expressed by stromal cells as well as smooth muscle cells
Used for visualization of intestinal crypt stem cells.

This marker cannot be used to define a specific anatomical structure but is expressed by all hematopoietic cells. This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP and can be used for downstream image analysis.
Used for visualization of various immune cells.
This antibody labels endothelial cells, mesenchymal cells, and reports the activation status of several immune cell subsets.
Used for visualization of lacteals (lymphatic endothelial cells) and fibroblasts. This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.

Used for visualization of the basal membrane and extracellular matrix. The combination of collagen IV, pan-cytokeratin, alpha smooth muscle actin, and vimentin can be used to define the villi, crypts, basal membrane, and lamina propria.
Used for identification of M2 macrophages. This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
Used for identification of intestinal crypt stem cells of small intestine.
Used for identification of M2 macrophages. This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
Used for identification of Paneth cells. This marker represents a prioritized target in the intestine OMAP.
